snippet: The changes President Obama outlined will have a profound impact on Cuba — where isolation by the U.S. has fundamentally shaped the island’s economy, its politics and even its national identity.
abstract: Cubans celebrate easing of restrictions on country by United States government; episode fuels hopes of economic and political change.

byline.original: By DAMIEN CAVE, RANDAL C. ARCHIBOLD and VICTORIA BURNETT
byline.contributor: Damien Cave reported from Havana, and Randal C. Archibold and Victoria Burnett from Mexico City. Elisabeth Malkin and Paulina Villegas contributed reporting from Mexico City.

lead_paragraph: The changes President Obama outlined will have a profound impact on Cuba — where isolation by the U.S. has fundamentally shaped the island’s economy, its politics and even its national identity.

headline.main: As Havana Celebrates Historic Shift, Economic and Political Hopes Rise
headline.print_headline: As Havana Celebrates Historic Shift, Economic and Political Hopes Rise
